document.title: New York State Next Generation English Language Arts Learning Standards

A9A0DC84D911452F8E2643D240D75635.description: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.

A43AE0E151EE495A826F9288ED66C063.description: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.

8117FDD71F7A47B8BDED5262BAECD6F2.description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

D945018830D0437F806AE7F271EA9195.description: Capitalize dates and names of people.

8CFE91E76CC0432680FD8AC57D250089.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

1E603F296A834197AA7E96682EB2E28A.description: Capitalize the first letter of their name.

9EBDFEF30A1E429B8FFD8F00141989E7.description: Consult reference materials as needed to check and correct spellings.

30866978DBB14A6FAE674E82041A8FD6.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

0D83F79BCC284D0CB0C37E06C5B8DB49.description: Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words (e.g., cage → rage; boy → toy).

353A15CB7B4A472997C5DC4F13A94D88.description: Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.

6E940478829C4753AA55738963539E3A.description: Spell unknown words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness and spelling conventions.

66D9F886AF264A33866DC21D90677274.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

91B17AA5190A42559F7329F69CEA169C.description: Attempt to write symbols or letters to represent words.

ED3C43FEC42C4F748600DAEA40CE454E.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of academic English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

35470CF8929D4EA8BBC6AE73E9345CB4.description: Understand and use simple and compound sentences in speech or writing (e.g., The child read the book; The child read the book, but she did not watch the movie).

D179AE715CD349A08B0504347D7597F7.description: Use frequently occurring transition words (e.g., first, then, therefore, finally)

8CB93D7F711C449AACC62A91AB4D0566.description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so because).

0E664110E39446FABE7FE27D4B48314D.description: Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).

4952284A6AD945EB9CBA1F133C41DA85.description: Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today I walk home; Tomorrow I will walk home).

E84E86D2208B4707BFEA60C54087D29A.description: Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their, anyone, everything).

46798198DCB34011B5026A5D29669EEC.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

C6F1B4E486A84EBCBF91B24182626AD5.description: Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

9BF19F1D352D497997EC0AF9335B7E21.description: Understand and use interrogatives (question words—e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

CB29B41BA235407683EE36E3082A68FD.description: Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic sentences (e.g., The boy jumps; The boys jump).

B46D813581474B29A3A94B7C418A5AAF.description: Form and use frequently occurring irregular plural nouns (e.g., feet, children, mice, fish).

ED0F4E8599084ED8936ACDDEA6CB6826.description: Form and use regular plural nouns (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

D4385B6F056842A9B9148FDA0D5084AC.description: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.

1A772F9622DF492B9B24C78AA95F6994.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

2299182317E24026BE8ED05931D99DCF.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs (orally)

0CC2EA842AFA4BAD9F60333C643A79B4.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.

FB92912C2BA74636A9E819601DF9A917.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters

7E8AD224C8354FD5BD8D2B0C40C2D193.description: Print upper- and lowercase letters in their name

7FDAC22410BA4B79AFF27EB1FD8A9F9D.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of academic English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

D47CBEC766B44D4F94EA32DBF1DF7B08.description: Conventions of Academic English/Language for Learning

111FC0B28BDE45A481477A55DFB6F3A7.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to.

D99ACF25E34A4A54BEAD0B27136A3EF8.description: Explore variations among verbs that describe the same general action (e.g., walk, march, gallop) by acting out the meanings.

02C2DFD8F5B549CA95AB318619F00F3F.description: Use words to identify and describe the world, making connections between words and their use (e.g., places at home that are colorful).

22D2A839606E4C7BBF871FB00BD28FF4.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

96D77AC7883A4CEBBF08FA07ED441BAD.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) for understanding of the concepts the categories represent.

59C03B01A96B44948E3152F5FAD52719.description: Explore and discuss word relationships and word meanings.

CEC70CB4365C40CF9890EF9869777073.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of a word.

EF324266DA694A8799BA243D2EB01B58.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

58E4E0D172794ECB935DB043C83B9D92.description: Explore and use new vocabulary and multiple-meaning words and phrases in authentic experiences, including, but not limited to the following.

18FA18EAA2E4476EA364A414D2456E90.description: Create and/or utilize existing visual displays to support descriptions.

83B05562BA894026A6EB2D4A8D9FC409.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events with detail.

1F2B57656D604D679065423F8C65C2F2.description: Develop and answer questions to clarify what the speaker says.

00AC4C8374A24884A4A7E6DDC7A39BE0.description: Participate in a conversation about features of diverse texts and formats.

DFF3ABEA743E41518987B2CC5D2AA577.description: Consider individual differences when communicating with others.

2DC08899011242F3A80E9C8CB3AF55B1.description: Participate in conversations through multiple exchanges.

DEB3B571CECF4F13A48AF4C26DFE6406.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions, including listening to others, taking turns, and staying on topic.

8A9E35A2FDFF4A77B33F6378C2AA2300.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse peers and adults in small and large groups and during play.

0F0F65F433EA47F89E7462D53349E539.description: Recall and represent relevant information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question in a variety of ways (e.g., drawing, oral expression, and/or emergent writing).

9A384CAAF5CF402497B7751BCED19437.description: Develop questions and participate in shared research and exploration to answer questions and to build and share knowledge.

D013C3443CC548A0AA0CD40C24841DC0.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

72B7C26A759D4D06919ACD3884E5398C.description: Create a response to a text, author, or personal experience (e.g., dramatization, art work, or poem).

4742338DA9BD4CD69E7B2AF8A29FDEC3.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, oral expression, and/or emergent writing to narrate an event or events in a sequence.

50987C3A3E6542348B019B386F27A76E.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, oral expression, and/or emergent writing to name a familiar topic and supply information.

25EAA00C1AA6418FBD0C330158E1094B.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, oral expression, and/or emergent writing to state an opinion about a familiar topic or personal experience and state a reason to support that topic.

B3A9773D07514DA1AAE2FA592036B46C.description: Read emergent-reader texts with sufficient accuracy to support comprehension.

A93CBC044926485EBA256AABEA4BB60E.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight.

A6C10F98EEFB48FC977CDC8360098E7D.description: Decode some regularly spelled one-syllable words.

158FDF1847C645C099A6541D503EA9D2.description: Decode short vowel sounds with common spellings.

46ED2F7994D94E6FAA78472C199A7E84.description: Demonstrate one-to-one letter-sound correspondence by producing the primary sound or most frequent sound for each consonant.

4A13B25AF7B247CB85DD83A6AA5B08C9.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

4BFCF69704A34A98B969AE4C8866A972.description: Create new words by manipulating the phonemes orally in one-syllable words.

24E58F17FF774253B20AF667CB1D09E2.description: Blend and segment individual sounds (phonemes) in spoken one-syllable words

C7EBCC8172A94A39AA135284212B13E5.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of spoken words.

00BC87BF30FD4A918320FB7B40FA8E2C.description: Blend and segment syllables in spoken words.

430F2CAAC00249B4B4784EFEDBAE5747.description: Recognize and produce spoken rhyming words.

C9962FDE6FC545C3B76AC826162B3006.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

831993C96E6549EE991BC47A54C0E6A0.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

1DD3660BF19942F18F45F81684DA4594.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

B84CC60CAF614BC68A02F85B1C7B1E83.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

F3AA6EA7E2AD4F9D8837710CB623EDE1.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

DE14709B3C1E470EAB4592296C2641E7.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

BBC82F5E17E34EC58E8BC5EE14BBA43C.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

32175BAE8C4B4348AB041C3DBFC03095.description: Make connections between self, text, and the world.

0DAD97F19FDB4CB08BDD5222350111BE.description: Identify specific information to support ideas in a text.

7AF1F849ED1D4F73891CDB78C6122EB0.description: Describe the relationship between illustrations and the text.

F42D54C8F913421B932BE13079751F8C.description: Name the author and illustrator and define the role of each in presenting the ideas in a text.

572046D54F3043119EC907048D8FDEDA.description: Identify specific words that express feelings and senses.

BB05D4CFC25642C3868B4235619D33E8.description: Identify characters, settings, major events in a story, or pieces of information in a text.

37FB2FE5EE1A4997A1C3999CA5A5FFE3.description: Retell stories or share key details from a text.

1A831758836C4E7DB6AF0B8DB97B9BA2.description: Develop and answer questions about a text.
